description.narrative: Stimulate agriculture in the conflict areas in the poor province of Equateur where the conflict is rooted in poverty and landrights. The project includes production, market development and minor improvement of infrastructure.

Stimulera jordbruket i konfliktområdena i den fattiga provinsen Equateur är konflikten handlar mycket om fattigdom och markrättigheter. Stödet inkluderar produktion, marknadsutveckling och mindre infrastrukturförbättrande åtgärder.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Although this project is executed in a post-conflict context, he nevertheless brought many significant improvements in the socio-economic life of the people of the Territory of Kungu. These improvements are noticeable through: (I) Outcome 1: Priorities for men, women and households to develop agricultural sectors are defined and agreed The study of promising agricultural sectors were carried out and a study report available. allowing households to engage in promising crops. This is the case of maize, groundnuts, rice and palm oil. (Ii) Outcome 2: Civil society is strengthened by the structuring of peasant organizations (POs) economically viable, where women and men are equally represented and access to a radio broadcast information involved The operation and sustainability of groups structured producers in the area. following the completion of a diagnostic analysis and structuring of beneficiary households in 5000 Federated 200 producer groups in 20 peasant organizations. (Iii) Results 3: Beneficiary households diversify and improve their production in quantity and quality 86% of beneficiary households have diversified their productions 87% of beneficiary households increased their productions 89% of beneficiary households have improved the quality of their productions Results 4: Beneficiary households increase their income through improved marketing conditions. 90% of beneficiary households increased their income. Rising incomes of beneficiary households is the: (i) a building 32 shelters to cover the units of transformations, (ii) construction of 3 warehouses for storage of agricultural products (iii) construction and development of 4 houses in chewed. the marriages have also benefited from two of training and coaching sessions. Maintenance services of production units followed. 2 / support training sessions on the use, conditions and maintenance of processing units. 377 bicycles were distributed to facilitate the evacuation of the products. 5 Results: The ability of technical services of the state is strengthened; they become able to provide technical support and assist community dynamics during and after the project and a plea is made for a greater integration of women in the technical services of the Ministry of Agriculture reinforced public services have played their part by organizing community mobilizers 3 campaigns.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
